Justice-Involved Veterans

Introduction

Among Veterans in VA Health Care, those with legal system involvement are at increased risk of suicide-related behavior. For example, the suicide rate for recipients of VA Justice Program services was 10.2% higher in 2021 than in 2020. VA connects with Veterans who are at various points in the legal system, through Veterans Justice Programs. VA is committed to advancing programs and resources that reintegrate Veterans into society, ultimately reducing this highly impacted groupâ€™s risk of suicide.

What Action Has VA Taken?

Health Care for Re-Entry Veterans (HCRV) Services

These services include pre-release assessment services for Veterans in prison. It also supports referrals and linkages to medical, mental health, and social services, including employment services on release and short-term case management assistance upon release.

The Veterans Re-Entry Search Service (VRSS)

VRSS is an easy-to-use tool that strengthens partnerships between the criminal justice facilities and VA services. Connection to these supports significantly increases employment prospects, reduces risk of homelessness, and suicide risk.
